title: Continental Earnings Hit Four-Year High on Cost Cuts
content: Continental AG more than doubled earnings in the first quarter as its car-parts unit slashed costs and tire sales bounced back from weaker levels last year.

title: US Stock Futures Dip as Wall Street Rally Stalls: Markets Wrap
content: US equity futures edged lower and European stocks were flat as investors digested the latest corporate results amid uncertainty about President Donald Trump’s tariff policies. The dollar was steady ahead of the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate decision.

title: FTSE 100 Live: UK Stocks Extend Winning Streak, BP Rises
Hartalega Expects Malaysian Glove Makers To Gain US Market Share
content: Despite the threat of high US tariffs, glove maker Hartalega Holdings Bhd. said Malaysian makers of the latex products are primed to gain further American market share as Chinese competitors face geopolitical headwinds.

title: European Gas Prices Rise on Concerns Over Global LNG Competition
content: European natural gas prices edged higher as some firms in Asia ramp up LNG purchases and seasonal maintenance tightens the market.

title: Horizons Middle East & Africa 05/06/2025
content: Horizons Middle East & Africa is your daily spotlight on one of the world's fastest-growing regions. Live from Dubai, we bring you the latest global markets and analysis, plus news-making interviews, with a special focus on MEA. All that and more, as you head to the office in the Gulf, pause for lunch in Hong Kong, or start your day in London or Johannesburg.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Vestas Keeps Earnings Forecast Despite ‘Global Uncertainty’
content: Vestas Wind Systems A/S maintained profit guidance for this year as it continues to execute on a turnaround plan after steep losses in recent years.

title: Indian E-Scooter Maker Ather’s Shares Reverse Early Listing Gain
content: Ather Energy Ltd.’s shares reversed early gains to fall Tuesday in their Mumbai debut, as traders look to India’s first major initial public offering this fiscal year for clues on the local equity capital market outlook.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin  5/6/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Vakhshouri: Oil Markets Expected OPEC+ Response
content:
Oil prices tumbled as the trading week began after OPEC+ agreed to increase output further in June. Sara Vakhshouri, President & Founder of SVB Energy International, spoke to Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor 
Joumanna Bercetche on the move from the oil producers (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Sudan’s Crucial Port Rocked by Blasts as Civil War Intensifies
content: Explosions rocked the airport and port at Sudan’s main coastal city on Tuesday, the latest escalation in two years of conflict between the North African nation’s army and the Rapid Support Forces militia.

title: How Ambani's Campa Cola is Hurting Coke, Pepsi in India
content:
Asia's richest man, Mukesh Ambani, is challenging Coca-Cola and PepsiCo's dominance in India with Reliance Industries' Campa Cola brand.
Bloomberg's Satviki Sanjay appeared on Insight with Haslinda Amin to discuss what's behind the growing success of the brand. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Saadi: Sentiment Rather Than Tariffs Impact Mideast Markets
content: Equity capital markets in the Middle East are defying the volatility induced by US President Donald Trump's tariffs. Dubai Holding, an investment conglomerate owned by Dubai's ruler plans to list a portfolio of residential property assets on the local exchange to capitalize on the emirate's real estate boom. Rudy Saadi, Managing Director and Head of MENA ECM at Citi told Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor Joumanna Bercetche on the timing of the REIT. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 05/06/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: What Albanese's Win Means for Australian Businesses
content: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese won a historic re-election on the promise of bolstering the economy, addressing the cost of living crisis, and tax cuts. Australian Chamber of Commerce and Industry CEO Andrew McKellar discusses the outlook for Australian businesses and the impact of Trump's tariff war on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Tariffs Force Bank of England to Consider Faster Pace of Cuts
content: The Bank of England is set to cut interest rates by a quarter point this week and may even pave the way for a series of back-to-back reductions for the first time since 2009 as it responds to America’s global trade war.

title: Ex-ArcelorMittal Dealmaker Seeks $1 Billion for Latest Fund
content: Synergy Capital, founded by former ArcelorMittal SA executive Sudhir Maheshwari, is looking to raise $1 billion by next year for its latest fund that focuses on private credit in Asia, particularly in India.

title: Chinese Media Reports Holiday Travel Surge
content: Chinese media are reporting a surge in travel and retail spending over the May Day holiday, with cross-regional passenger traffic up 8%. But as Bloomberg's China correspondent, Minmin Low, explains - not all of the data so far paints a rosy picture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: South Korea to Seal Nuclear Deal With Czech Republic This Week
content: A South Korean group, led by Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power Co., will sign a final agreement to build two nuclear reactors at the Dukovany complex in the Czech Republic this week, Seoul’s industry ministry said in a statement.

title: Gold Extends Gains on Demand From China Following Holidays
content: Gold extended gains — following a surge of almost 3% on Monday — as the world’s biggest bullion buyer came back from holiday, boosting demand despite a firmer dollar.

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 5/6/2025
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: JPMorgan and BofA Stick With CATL Deal Despite US House Opposition
content: JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Bank of America Corp. have forged ahead working on the blockbuster listing of Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. despite a US congressional committee calling for the American lenders to drop out of the deal.

title: Thai Inflation Turning Negative Set to Aid More Rate Cuts
content: Thailand’s inflation turned negative for the first time in more than a year on cheaper fuel prices and increased fresh food supplies, creating more room for the central bank to cut rates further to deal with the impact of the trade war.

title: Shanghai Gold Exchange to Expand Warehouse Network to Hong Kong
content: The Shanghai Gold Exchange plans to expand its warehouse network to Hong Kong, helping to raise the profile of its yuan-denominated products, including for the precious metal, beyond mainland China.

title: Chinese Trade Flow Resilient at End of April Despite US Tariffs
content: China’s trade flows increased at the end of April, indicating the damage from US tariffs has yet to manifest in actual shipments even though the trade war is widely expected to eventually slow the world’s second-largest economy.

title: SMFG Said to Be in Talks to Buy Minority Stake in Yes Bank
content: Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group Inc., Japan’s second-biggest lender, is in talks to buy a significant minority stake in India’s Yes Bank Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Oil Gains From Four-Year Low as Technicals Hint Slide Overdone
content: Oil climbed from the lowest close in four years after a technical measure signaled the recent slump was overdone.

title: Clearlake Seeks to Triple Assets at Credit Unit to $100 Billion
content: Clearlake Capital Group is aiming to triple its credit business with the launch of a unit to help the buyout firm grab a bigger slice of the booming asset class.

title: Hong Kong Ramps Up FX Intervention to Defend Currency Peg
content: Hong Kong authorities ramped up sales of the local dollar as the greenback’s slide threatened the foreign-exchange peg.

title: Wall Street Banks Said to Steer Clear of Chery’s $1.5 Billion Hong Kong IPO
content: One of this year’s biggest listings is coming together in Hong Kong without the involvement of Wall Street banks.

title: Russia Mulls Tightening Budget Rule Over Slumping Oil Prices
content: Russia is considering changing its key budget-building mechanism in response to sliding oil revenue, in a sign the Kremlin expects crude prices will remain lower for longer while the war in Ukraine continues to drain state coffers.

title: Myanmar Junta Extends Post-Quake Truce Amid Reports of Breaches
content: Myanmar’s military, also known as the Tatmadaw, announced an extension of a ceasefire until the end of this month, though there have been multiple reports of continued air strikes and mortar attacks on rebel-held territories during the recent truce.

title: Sudan’s Crucial Port Rocked by Blasts as Civil War Intensifies
content: Explosions rocked the airport and port at Sudan’s main coastal city on Tuesday, the latest escalation in two years of conflict between the North African nation’s army and the Rapid Support Forces militia.

title: Pakistan Says India Chokes River Flow as Tensions Rise
content: Pakistan alleged that India has almost entirely stopped the flow of water across the border through the Chenab river as fears of a clash between the two neighbors mount following a deadly attack in Kashmir.

title: Merz to Start as German Chancellor, Replacing Scholz
content: Friedrich Merz will take over as German Chancellor on Tuesday, replacing Olaf Scholz. After a confirmation vote in the lower house of parliament in Berlin, the conservative leader will be sworn in as the head of a coalition government of his center-right CDU/CSU bloc and the center-left party Social Democrats. Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook reports.

title: German Conservative Merz Wants a Fast Start as New Chancellor
content: Friedrich Merz has vowed to hit the ground running when he takes over as German chancellor on Tuesday, pledging swift action to galvanize Europe’s biggest economy, restore Berlin’s leadership role on the global stage and address voter concerns about irregular migration.

title: NY Acts to Bar Trump DOT From Denying Funds in Congestion Case
content: New York asked a judge to stop the Trump administration from withholding federal approvals or funds in the president’s push to end Manhattan’s congestion pricing program.

title: India Offers Zero-for-Zero Tariffs on Auto Parts, Steel From US
content: India has proposed zero tariffs on steel, auto components and pharmaceuticals on a reciprocal basis up to a certain quantity of imports in its trade negotiations with the US, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Trump Blocks Harvard From New Research Funding in Latest Blow
content: The Trump administration is declaring Harvard University ineligible for new research grants from the federal government in the latest escalation between the White House and the Ivy League school.

title: Hegseth Says ‘Lean and Mean’ Military Requires Cutting Officers
content: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth ordered a reduction of the US military’s highest-ranking officers — potentially setting up a clash with Congress, which must approve any such adjustments.

title: Sri Lanka’s President Seeks Reform Mandate From Local Elections
content: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake swept to power last year with an unprecedented super-majority government. Now, he arguably faces an even more crucial election.

title: Stablecoin Coalition Cracks as Democrats Threaten Filibuster
content: A bipartisan alliance backing stablecoin legislation shattered in the US Senate as a key group of Democrats threatened to block a bill that Republicans had hoped to pass this month — unless “numerous” fixes are made.

title: Alberta’s Smith Plans Talks With Carney, Says Separation Vote Possible
content: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith said she’s appointing a group to negotiate with the Canadian government on removing laws that restrict energy production, adding that a referendum on the province separating from Canada may be on the ballot as soon as next year.

title: Trump Administration Offers Migrants $1,000 to Self-Deport
content: The Trump administration is offering undocumented migrants $1,000 and paid travel if they agree to leave the US voluntarily, the latest effort to ramp up mass deportations and slash enforcement costs.

title: New Zealand’s National Party Seeks Social Media Age Restrictions
content: New Zealand’s governing National Party wants to restrict access to social media for those aged under 16 years, mirroring a move in Australia that sparked criticism from global tech giants.

title: Milken Crowd Warms Up to Tariffs While Condemning All the Chaos
content: Scott Bessent walked on stage at the largest gathering in months of Wall Street’s champions of global trade, aiming to explain why President Donald Trump is putting up hurdles to global trade.

title: US Space-Based Missile Defense Could Cost $542 Billion, CBO Says
content: The US may need to spend up to $542 billion over 20 years to develop and launch a network of space-based interceptors, the Congressional Budget Office said, putting a rough cost estimate on an unproven part of President Donald Trump’s proposed “Golden Dome” defense system.

title: FCC’s Carr Calls for Spectrum, AI Leadership in China Race
content: The Trump administration is focused on freeing up more electromagnetic spectrum to power wireless communication, the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission said on Monday, a move that could generate $80 billion in government revenue and help the US better compete with China.

title: Trump Signs Order Targeting Gain-of-Function Virus Research
content: President Donald Trump signed an executive order looking to limit federal funding for gain-of-function research that involves altering pathogens, suggesting the efforts could have been responsible for the outbreak of the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Adani Camp Meets Trump Officials in Bid to End Bribery Cases
content: Representatives for Indian billionaire Gautam Adani and his companies met Trump administration officials about dismissing the criminal charges levied against him in an overseas bribery probe, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Trump’s First Deals on Tariffs: How Soon Is Soon Enough?
content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: UK Reaffirms Support for Film Industry After Trump Tariff Threat
content: The UK government will shortly unveil a new industrial policy for its film sector, as it reaffirms support for its creative industries after US President Donald Trump revealed plans to hit movies produced overseas with a 100% tariff.

title: Gabon New Leader Appoints Two Vice Presidents to Government
content: Gabon’s new leader Brice Oligui Nguema has named two vice presidents to help steer affairs in the OPEC member nation, two days after he was sworn into office.

title: Mehmet Oz Questions Federal Funding for Medicaid Expansion
content: Mehmet Oz, the US Centers for Medicaid and Medicare Services leader, suggested he supports reducing federal Medicaid funding for the millions of people who gained access to the program through the Affordable Care Act.

title: Trump Vows to Meet Hollywood on Tariff Plan That Shook Industry
content: President Donald Trump said he would meet with Hollywood executives after confounding the US film industry over his plan to impose a 100% tariff on movies made overseas.

title: Message App That Waltz Was Seen Using Is Probing Possible Breach
content: TeleMessage, the message-archiving app that former National Security Adviser Michael Waltz appeared to be using in a photograph of him communicating with other Trump administration officials, is investigating whether hackers exploited its technology.

title: Israel to Step Up Gaza Fighting, Set to Hold More Territory
content: Israel’s security cabinet voted to intensify military operations in Gaza and call up of tens of thousands of extra reservists, while also deciding on a means of distributing aid in the Palestinian territory.

title: Dropping Oil Price Boosts Odds of Ukraine Peace Deal, Trump Says
content: President Donald Trump said the sliding price of oil is intensifying pressure on Russia and boosting the odds for a deal to end its war in Ukraine.

title: US Army Puts Chopper Training Flights Around Pentagon on Pause
content: The US Army is suspending helicopter training flights around the Pentagon and Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport as authorities investigate an incident last week that saw two passenger jets abort landings to avoid a Black Hawk in the area.

title: Trump Announces 2027 NFL Draft Will Be on DC’s National Mall
content: President Donald Trump announced Washington will host the 2027 National Football League draft, saying it will provide a boost to the nation’s capital.

content:
Rep. Bryon Donalds (R) Florida shares his thoughts on the current progress of the GOP Tax Bill stating the process is going at a "deliberative pace." Rep. Donalds speaks with David Gura and Julie Fine on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power."

title: Disney’s ‘Thunderbolts*’ Opens to $74 Million in US, Canada
content: Thunderbolts*, the latest film in Walt Disney Co.’s Marvel Cinematic Universe of superhero titles, was the No. 1 movie this weekend, grossing $74.3 million in US and Canadian ticket sales in its debut.

content: Get caught up.

title: Mattel Pulls 2025 Forecast, Citing Tariffs’ Impact on Toys
content: Mattel Inc. withdrew its forecast for a return to sales growth in 2025, citing US President Donald Trump’s plan to impose tariffs on imported toys.

content: On today’s Big Take podcast: How the “Oracle of Omaha” changed investing and what comes next for the company Buffett built. ​​​​​

title: GOP Tax Bill 'Devastating:' Rep. Brendan Boyle
content: Rep. Brendan Boyle (D) Pennsylvania weighs in on what the Democratic strategy is as House Republican's work on the tax bill is pushed back to next week. Rep Boyle talks about how devastating it would be if Medicaid gets cut, how Democrats are speaking about and trying to prevent cuts to Medicaid, and what the realistic timeline looks like to get the Tax bill done. Representative Boyle speaks with Julie Fine & David Gura on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Apple, GM See Pressure From Bond Investors as Trade Fears Swirl
content: Apple Inc. and General Motors Co. had to pay up on bonds they sold on Monday, a sign investors are demanding more to hold debt from companies under pressure from President Donald Trump’s tariff offensive.

title: Philips Cuts Margin Guidance Over US-China Trade Tensions
content: Royal Philips NV lowered its profitability outlook for the year due to the cost of dealing with rising trade hurdles.

title: DoorDash Agrees to Buy Deliveroo in $3.9 Billion Deal
content: DoorDash Inc. has agreed to buy UK-based food-delivery platform Deliveroo Plc for an equity value of about £2.9 billion ($3.9 billion), as the US company pushes into more overseas markets.

title: Staking Firm Figment Hunts Acquisitions Amid Crypto Deal Spree
content: Figment is looking for acquisition targets, potentially extending a flurry of dealmaking in the digital-assets space triggered by President Donald Trump’s pro-crypto agenda.

title: Gavin Newsom Seeks $7.5 Billion Hollywood Aid, Trump Accord
content: California Governor Gavin Newsom called for federal tax credits of at least $7.5 billion and a partnership with the Donald Trump White House to help bring more filmmaking to the US.

title: Microsoft Expands Carbon Removal Deal With Stockholm Exergi
content: Microsoft Corp. expanded its deal to buy carbon removal credits from heat-plant operator Stockholm Exergi AB, increasing volumes first agreed last year by more than 50%.

title: Musk’s Lawyer Says OpenAI Reform Proposal ‘Changes Nothing’
content: Elon Musk’s attorney said OpenAI’s decision to partly walk back its plan to restructure as a for-profit business “changes nothing,” a sign the billionaire may continue with his legal crusade against the startup led by Sam Altman.

title: Developing Nations Expect AI Productivity Boost Soon, UN Finds
content: Most people in the developing world expect artificial intelligence to boost productivity over the next year, the United Nations found, with new technologies potentially helping to counter an “unprecedented slowdown” in human development.

title: US Seeks Forced Sale of Google Ad Technology Products
content: Alphabet Inc.’s Google should be forced to sell off two of its businesses that help websites buy, sell and serve online advertising after a judge found the company illegally monopolized those markets, the Justice Department said.

title: Mideast Titans Step Back From AI Model Race as US, China Dominate
content: Within months of ChatGPT’s release in late 2022, research labs in the United Arab Emirates claimed to have developed credible rivals. At the top of the list was Falcon, a popular open-source artificial intelligence system built with government support, and Jais, a model named for the country’s highest mountain peak.

title: OpenAI Reaches Agreement to Buy Startup Windsurf for $3 Billion
content: OpenAI has agreed to buy Windsurf, an artificial intelligence-assisted coding tool formerly known as Codeium, for about $3 billion, according to people familiar with the matter, marking the ChatGPT maker’s largest acquisition to date.

title: Microsoft Is Key Holdout for OpenAI Restructuring Plan
content: After months of public pressure, OpenAI walked back part of its effort to create a more conventional for-profit company, but its restructuring plans still have not received the blessing of a major stakeholder: Microsoft Corp.

title: ServiceNow Eyes $1 Billion Revenue for AI Product by 2026
content: ServiceNow Inc. said its flagship artificial intelligence software product will hit $1 billion in annual contracted business by next year.

title: Palantir Sales Forecast Falls Short of Wall Street’s Hopes
content: Palantir Technologies Inc. dropped more than 8% in late trading Monday after its results failed to live up to investors’ loftiest expectations for a company whose stock has led the S&P 500 in gains this year.

title: New Zealand’s National Party Seeks Social Media Age Restrictions
content: New Zealand’s governing National Party wants to restrict access to social media for those aged under 16 years, mirroring a move in Australia that sparked criticism from global tech giants.

title: Apple, GM See Pressure From Bond Investors as Trade Fears Swirl
content: Apple Inc. and General Motors Co. had to pay up on bonds they sold on Monday, a sign investors are demanding more to hold debt from companies under pressure from President Donald Trump’s tariff offensive.

title: Andreessen-Backed AI Bot Startup 11x Replaces CEO Sukkar
content: Hasan Sukkar, founder and chief executive officer of the artificial intelligence startup 11x AI Inc., has stepped down, according to a LinkedIn post. He will transition to the role of non-executive chairman.

title: FCC’s Carr Calls for Spectrum, AI Leadership in China Race
content: The Trump administration is focused on freeing up more electromagnetic spectrum to power wireless communication, the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission said on Monday, a move that could generate $80 billion in government revenue and help the US better compete with China.

title: Bessent on AI, Hollywood Shaken by Tariff Threat | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde discusses the drop in media stocks following President Trump’s proposal to impose 100% tariffs on foreign-produced movies. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, speaking from the Milken Institute Global Conference, says the US must win the race to develop artificial intelligence as China closes the gap. Daniel Morgan, senior portfolio manager at Synovus Trust, explains what's behind the market dip after a four-day rally. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: GameStop Sells Its Canadian Business to Toy Entrepreneur
content: French-Canadian entrepreneur Stephan Tétrault has acquired GameStop Corp.’s Canadian stores, according to a Monday press release.

title: DoorDash Is the Latest Tech Firm to Commit Millions to NYC Elections
content: DoorDash Inc. is committing $5 million to back political candidates in New York City and state-level races in New Jersey this year, becoming the latest technology company to disclose its lobbying efforts ahead of local elections in the tristate area.

title: OpenAI Walks Back For-Profit Plan, Nonprofit to Keep Control
content: OpenAI is backtracking on plans to become a more conventional for-profit company after facing mounting pressure from former employees, academics and rivals, including billionaire Elon Musk.

title: Goldman Sees Buy-the-Dip Opportunity in AI After Big Tech Earnings
content: Better-than-expected results late last month from some of the biggest technology companies using artificial intelligence signal an opportunity for investors to pick up shares in the cohort after the recent slump, according to a group of analysts at Goldman Sachs.

title: Message App That Waltz Was Seen Using Is Probing Possible Breach
content: TeleMessage, the message-archiving app that former National Security Adviser Michael Waltz appeared to be using in a photograph of him communicating with other Trump administration officials, is investigating whether hackers exploited its technology.

title: Palantir’s History of Blowouts Faces Highest Multiple on Wall St
content: Palantir Technologies Inc. investors have been betting that the results coming after the markets close on Monday will be another blowout, but the recent run up has given the stock a high bar to clear.

title: Rivian Deepens Illinois Ties With $120 Million EV Supplier Park
content: Rivian Automotive Inc. is investing $120 million in a new supplier park in Illinois, another win for Governor JB Pritzker after the company announced a $1.5 billion plan to expand its plant in the state.

title: Macron Urges US Scientists to Choose Europe After Trump Upheaval
content: French President Emmanuel Macron made a plea to US-based researchers who have been affected by Donald Trump’s policies to choose Europe.

title: Saudi-Backed Port Developer Weighs South Africa Harbor Deal
content: Saudi Arabian ports operator Red Sea Gateway Terminal, backed by the kingdom’s $925 billion sovereign wealth fund, is evaluating whether to bid to develop and run a fresh-produce terminal at Africa’s biggest maritime hub.

title: Starlink Rival Eutelsat Replaces CEO With Telecom Executive
content: Eutelsat Communications SA, the French satellite operator that Europe is trying to position as a homegrown alternative to Elon Musk’s Starlink, is replacing its chief executive officer.

title: Apple Reaches Critical Juncture With Tariffs, AI and Services Turmoil
content: Apple is facing one of its toughest periods yet as it copes with the threat of tariffs, supply chain challenges, AI struggles and potential turmoil in its services business. Also: The company’s China AI launch will likely be part of iOS 18.6, reorganizations extend to Apple’s music and global affairs teams, and flying taxi startup Archer hires a new head of AI.

title: Effort to Close De Minimis US Tariff Loophole ‘Could Get Messy’
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Spencer Soper reports that closing the de minimis duty-free loophole for low-cost goods into the US is likely to have ripple effects across the economic landscape.

title: Chinese Consumers Weather Trade War in First Big Holiday Test
content: Chinese consumers persevered at malls and restaurants during one of the country’s busiest holiday periods, though sentiment remains shaky against the backdrop of a new trade war with the US.

title: Swedbank Sees Riksbank Delivering Two More Rate Cuts This Year
content: Analysts at Swedbank AB now expect the Riksbank to cut its key interest rate twice by the end of the third quarter, to 1.75%, saying that lower inflation would allow policymakers to bolster the still-sluggish economy.

title: Tariffs Force Bank of England to Consider Faster Pace of Cuts
content: The Bank of England is set to cut interest rates by a quarter point this week and may even pave the way for a series of back-to-back reductions for the first time since 2009 as it responds to America’s global trade war.

title: Thai Inflation Turning Negative Set to Aid More Rate Cuts
content: Thailand’s inflation turned negative for the first time in more than a year on cheaper fuel prices and increased fresh food supplies, creating more room for the central bank to cut rates further to deal with the impact of the trade war.

title: Chinese Trade Flow Resilient at End of April Despite US Tariffs
content: China’s trade flows increased at the end of April, indicating the damage from US tariffs has yet to manifest in actual shipments even though the trade war is widely expected to eventually slow the world’s second-largest economy.

title: Developing Nations Expect AI Productivity Boost Soon, UN Finds
content: Most people in the developing world expect artificial intelligence to boost productivity over the next year, the United Nations found, with new technologies potentially helping to counter an “unprecedented slowdown” in human development.

title: Moody’s Sees Key Risk to Malaysia Credit Rating From Tariffs
content: Tariff shocks pose a major threat to Malaysia’s sovereign credit rating, given the potential disruption to economic growth and fiscal consolidation, according to Moody’s Ratings.

title: India Offers Zero-for-Zero Tariffs on Auto Parts, Steel From US
content: India has proposed zero tariffs on steel, auto components and pharmaceuticals on a reciprocal basis up to a certain quantity of imports in its trade negotiations with the US, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Philippines Signals More Rate Cuts After Inflation Slowdown
content: The Philippine central bank on Tuesday signaled further monetary easing ahead after inflation slowed to the lowest level since 2019, and warned of a “more challenging external environment.”

title: China Services Activity Slips, Adding Risk of Rapid Slowdown
content: China’s services activity deteriorated more than expected in April, a private survey showed, the latest setback for an economy already under pressure from US tariffs.

title: Australia’s Household Spending Surprisingly Drops on Cyclone Hit
content: Australia’s household spending unexpectedly declined in March, snapping five months of increases as the impact of a major storm in the nation’s northeast disrupted activity.

title: Macquarie CEO Says Australia Is Resilient Despite Tariffs
content: Macquarie Group Ltd. Chief Executive Officer Shemara Wikramanayake said Australia’s economy is looking resilient and is set up well to withstand the shocks emanating from US trade policy.

title: Non-Dom Changes May Cost UK More Than It Raises, Research Warns
content: The UK’s tax overhaul for wealthy foreigners will start costing more than it raises if one in four of those affected leaves the country, according to the Centre for Economics and Business Research.

title: CBO Chief Still Sees US Treasury ‘X-Date’ Coming Late Summer
content: The head of the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office said the US Treasury Department can likely keep paying the government’s bills until late summer before Congress must act to raise or suspend the debt ceiling.

title: Milken Crowd Warms Up to Tariffs While Condemning All the Chaos
content: Scott Bessent walked on stage at the largest gathering in months of Wall Street’s champions of global trade, aiming to explain why President Donald Trump is putting up hurdles to global trade.

title: California Warns of 9% Drop in Foreign Visits in Trump Backlash
content: California warned that a plunge in international travel is set to hit tourism revenue after record spending from visitors last year.

title: Nigeria’s Tinubu Set to Sign Order Prioritizing Local Industries
content: Nigeria’s President Bola Tinubu plans to sign an executive order that will prioritize the procurement of goods and services from local firms, a move that bears some semblance to President Donald Trump’s “America First” agenda that champions US interests.

title: Bessent Touts US as ‘Premier Destination’ for World Capital
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent touted the US as the “premier destination” for global capital and argued that the Trump administration’s policies will solidify that position — countering the so-called sell America theme that materialized last month.

title: ECB’s Stournaras Says Interest-Rate Cuts Are Likely to Continue
content: The European Central Bank is set to carry on cutting interest rates, according to Governing Council member Yannis Stournaras.

title: Growth at US Service Providers Picks Up After Slumping in March
content: Activity at US service providers accelerated in April after a slumping in the prior month, while materials prices increased in response to escalating tariffs.

title: Trade Chaos Is Part of the Plan for Trump, Nightmare for Powell
content: Jim Tuchler, a Chicago-area retailer, and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell have a lot in common these days.

title: Saudi Arabia’s Budget Deficit Soared Even Before Oil’s Slump
content: Saudi Arabia’s budget deficit ballooned in the first quarter, even before oil’s latest drop put additional pressure on the kingdom’s finances.

title: Tariff Concerns Dominate First Day of Milken Conference
Brazil Economists Cut Interest-Rate Forecast on Eve of Policy Meeting
content: Brazil economists cut their 2025 year-end benchmark interest rate forecast just hours before central bankers gather to start debating the size of their next — and perhaps last — borrowing cost hike of their cycle.

title: US Border Towns Are Being Ravaged by Canada’s Furious Boycott
content: Economically dependent on their northern neighbor, business owners in Washington state are laying off employees and shutting their doors.

title: Pakistan Cuts Rate to Shield Economy From Tariff Disruptions
content: Pakistan cut its benchmark interest rate to shield the South Asian nation’s economy from global tariff-related disruption.

title: The Buffett View of Trade Deals
content: The most pertinent thing Warren Buffett said at the weekend beyond announcing his retirement at age 94 wasn’t his thoughts on the tariffs roiling the global economy (he’s not a fan) but his defense of Berkshire Hathaway’s $350 billion cash pile. It was, he said, a consequence of abiding by his principle to invest only in deals that offered meaningful returns and his view there had not been many lately.

title: ‘Strategic Uncertainty’ in US Trade Strategy Toughens Fed’s Job
content: I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston, and today we’re looking at reporting by Craig Torres and Michael Sasso on uncertainty and the Fed. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.

title: South Africa’s Eskom Sees Low Power-Cut Risk as Demand Rises
content: South Africa’s state power utility said the increased reliability of its electricity network will reduce the risk of outages this winter, when demand is expected to increase.

title: Malaysia Seeks to Bring US-Imposed Tariffs Down to Zero in Talks
content: Malaysia is negotiating with the US to bring its tariffs on the Southeast Asian nation down to zero, from the 24% that President Donald Trump pledged to impose, according to Investment, Trade and Industry Minister Zafrul Aziz.

title: AB Foods Confirms Talks With Endless on Future of Bread Unit
content: Associated British Foods Plc said it’s in talks with Endless over a potential combination of the Kingsmill and Hovis brands, two of the UK’s best-known bread producers.

title: Fortress Co-CEO Leaves Texas for London to Lead European Growth
content: Fortress Investment Group co-chief executive officer Josh Pack is moving to London from Dallas as the alternative asset manager ramps up plans to expand in Europe.

title: Vestas Keeps Earnings Forecast Despite ‘Global Uncertainty’
content: Vestas Wind Systems A/S maintained profit guidance for this year as it continues to execute on a turnaround plan after steep losses in recent years.

title: Uniper Reports First-Quarter Loss After Decline in Energy Prices
content: German utility Uniper SE confirmed a first-quarter loss after a drop in energy prices since the start of the year.

title: South Africa’s Second-Largest Asset Manager Eyes East Africa for Growth
content: South Africa’s second-biggest asset manager plans to grow its market share in East Africa to take advantage of the continent’s fastest growing region.

title: Ex-ArcelorMittal Dealmaker Seeks $1 Billion for Latest Fund
content: Synergy Capital, founded by former ArcelorMittal SA executive Sudhir Maheshwari, is looking to raise $1 billion by next year for its latest fund that focuses on private credit in Asia, particularly in India.

title: Shanghai Gold Exchange to Expand Warehouse Network to Hong Kong
content: The Shanghai Gold Exchange plans to expand its warehouse network to Hong Kong, helping to raise the profile of its yuan-denominated products, including for the precious metal, beyond mainland China.

title: Oil Gains From Four-Year Low as Technicals Hint Slide Overdone
content: Oil climbed from the lowest close in four years after a technical measure signaled the recent slump was overdone.

title: India Offers Zero-for-Zero Tariffs on Auto Parts, Steel From US
content: India has proposed zero tariffs on steel, auto components and pharmaceuticals on a reciprocal basis up to a certain quantity of imports in its trade negotiations with the US, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Ambani’s 12-Cent Cola Is Eroding Coke, Pepsi Dominance in India
content: Asia’s richest man is challenging the decades-long dominance of Coca-Cola Co. and PepsiCo Inc. in the most-populous country using a playbook he has practiced to perfection in other sectors: price disruption.

title: UBS Will Pay $511 Million to End Credit Suisse US Tax Probe
content: UBS Group AG agreed to pay $511 million to settle a US investigation into how Credit Suisse Group, the Swiss bank it bought, helped rich Americans evade taxes even after pledging to stop the practice a decade ago.

title: Ford Pulls Outlook, Sees $1.5 Billion Hit From Trump Tariffs
content: Ford Motor Co. suspended its full-year financial guidance and said President Donald Trump’s auto tariffs will take a toll on profit, joining rivals stung by volatile global trade policies.

title: Hims Reiterates 2025 Sales Guidance With Future in Flux
content: Hims & Hers Health Inc. reiterated its 2025 revenue forecast after posting better-than-expected sales for the first quarter, raising questions about the future as it shifts from making copycat weight-loss drugs to selling discounted versions of Novo Nordisk A/S’s blockbuster Wegovy.

title: Rite Aid Files for Second Bankruptcy, Announces Job Cuts
content: Less than a year after completing a restructuring that was supposed to turn the troubled pharmacy chain around, Rite Aid Corp. has filed for bankruptcy again.

title: Northwestern CIO Warns of ‘Destructive’ Tax on University Funds
content: Northwestern University is preparing for a potential tax increase on endowments, a move its chief investment officer labeled as “destructive” for higher education institutions in the US.

title: Vertex Says 20,000 Prescriptions Filled for Non-Opioid Pain Drug
content: Vertex Pharmaceuticals Inc. said more than 20,000 prescriptions have been dispensed for its new non-addictive painkiller, a sign that the drug is gaining some early traction as it attempts to displace opioids.

title: Newark Radar Failure Left Controllers Blind for 90 Seconds
content: Air traffic controllers guiding planes bound for Newark Liberty International Airport lost radar and radio communication for more than a minute early last week before flights at the key hub were snarled for days, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Nike President O’Neill Out in Latest Shake-Up Under New CEO
content: Nike Inc. is reorganizing its senior leadership team as its new chief executive officer shakes up several top roles at the world’s largest sportswear company.

title: Telemarketers Are Using a Weird Trick to Sell Bare-Bones Health Plans
content: How a former TV comedy writer’s fake-job loophole could blow up Obamacare.

title: Bristol Myers Promises $40 Billion US Investment Over Five Years
content: Bristol Myers Squibb Co. said it will spend $40 billion in the US over the next five years, joining a slew of drug companies promising to bolster their domestic investments as President Donald Trump threatens to impose tariffs on the pharmaceutical industry.

title: Nearly Quarter of People on Long-Acting Opioids Develop Addiction
content: More than one in five people prescribed extended-release painkillers such as OxyContin developed an addiction within a year, according to a newly released study mandated by the US Food and Drug Administration.

title: Clorox Lowers Sales Outlook as Consumers Cut Back on Shopping
content: Clorox Co. lowered to top end of its full-year sales outlook as the worsening economic backdrop saw consumers cut back on spending.

title: UK Reaffirms Support for Film Industry After Trump Tariff Threat
content: The UK government will shortly unveil a new industrial policy for its film sector, as it reaffirms support for its creative industries after US President Donald Trump revealed plans to hit movies produced overseas with a 100% tariff.

title: New York Times Leads Pulitzers With Four; Bloomberg Wins One
content: The New York Times won four Pulitzer Prizes, including the Explanatory Reporting award for its examination of the failures and missteps made by the US in Afghanistan. Bloomberg News won its second Pulitzer — for Alexandra Lange’s criticism on architectural design.

title: Private Bus Operator Boxcar Ramps Up as NJ Transit Strike Looms
content: Private bus operator Boxcar Inc. aims to ramp up service as a potential New Jersey Transit rail workers strike threatens to strand commuters as early as May 16.

title: Oil Drops as OPEC+ Supply Surge Threatens to Swamp Global Market
content: Oil dropped after OPEC+ agreed to another large output increase, raising concern that additional supply could lead to a global glut just as the trade war threatens demand.

title: Mehmet Oz Questions Federal Funding for Medicaid Expansion
content: Mehmet Oz, the US Centers for Medicaid and Medicare Services leader, suggested he supports reducing federal Medicaid funding for the millions of people who gained access to the program through the Affordable Care Act.

title: Trump Vows to Meet Hollywood on Tariff Plan That Shook Industry
content: President Donald Trump said he would meet with Hollywood executives after confounding the US film industry over his plan to impose a 100% tariff on movies made overseas.

title: Citi CEO Says Conflicting Data a Challenge to Fed Rate Decision
content: Conflicting economic signals including strong payrolls and weak consumer sentiment are making the job of Federal Reserve policymakers especially tricky, according to Citigroup Inc. Chief Executive Officer Jane Fraser.

title: 3G Capital to Take Tariff-Hit Skechers Private for $9.4 Billion
content: 3G Capital will acquire footwear maker Skechers USA Inc. for $9.4 billion, marking a splashy return to dealmaking for the investment firm after nearly four years.

title: New MCU Report Reveals That Avengers: Doomsday Directors Joe & Anthony Russo Directed The Thunderbolts* Post-Credit Scene
content: The Russo bros. reportedly directed Thunderbolts*' post-credits scene, which suggests it's more closely linked to Avengers: Doomsday than it seems.

title: Your AI-powered credit card will shop for you now
content: We're not lazy enough, so Visa and Mastercard have hired AI personal assistants to do our shopping

title: Elon Musk, DOGE team credit fed workers for helping trim waste, fraud
content: Elon Musk and his DOGE team expressed their gratitude Thursday to the federal employees partnering with the cost-cutting agency as they work around the clock to eliminate wasteful spending and modernize the workforce.

title: Legislators propose upgraded tax credit for short line rail maintenance
content: New legislation would upgrade a federal tax credit short line railroads depend on for infrastructure spending.

title: Subscription scams surge across hundreds of fake websites - how to stay safe
content: Subscription scams are popping up on social media sites, attempting to trick users out of their credit card information.

title: Trump praises Gov. Gretchen Whitmer while at Michigan air base
content: Trump announced a new series of fighter jets for the Selfridge Air National Guard base in Michigan, giving credit in part to Democratic Gov. Gretchen Whitmer.

title: Can't make your credit card payments this May? Here's what to do.
content: At risk of falling behind on your credit card bills this May? Here's what to do before your debt and fees spiral.

title: Best Credit Cards for Cashback & Rewards in 2025 [Expert Picks]
content: In this guide, we break down the best credit cards for cashback and rewards in 2025, handpicked for U.S. consumers looking to get the most out of every dollar

title: 7 Simple Steps to Improve Your Credit Score Fast
content: If you are wondering how to improve your credit score fast, the key lies in taking targeted actions that have immediate impact. Start by paying off

title: ‘King of All Pimps’ — who recruited then-NY Gov. Eliot Spitzer hooker Ashley Dupré — claims his reputation was trashed by murder claim
content: A notorious pimp who took credit for recruiting Ashley Dupré, the hooker whose tryst with then-Gov. Eliot Spitzer ended the "Luv Guv's" career, claims in a lawsuit that a YouTuber has ruined his rep.

Philips cuts annual profit estimates as trade war clouds outlook

Eurozone: Sentix-Konjunkturindex zieht nach Zoll-Schock wieder an

USA: Beschäftigungzahl steigt stärker als erwartet
Arbeitsmarkt: Mehr neue Jobs in den USA – aber das Wachstum verliert an Tempo

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission’s Small Business Capital Formation Advisory Committee announced that its meeting on Tuesday, May 6, 2025, will focus on the practical market considerations and regulatory challenges of Regulation A. Members of the…

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced a two-year extension of the effective and compliance dates for rule amendments adopted in August 2024 that require many types of registered funds to more frequently report portfolio-related…

title: SEC’s Anti-Fraud Public Service Campaign Warns Investors About Relationship Investment Scams
content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

title: SEC Publishes New Data and Analysis About Registered Investment Companies and Money Market Funds
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today published new data and analysis in a pair of reports that provide the investing public with updated key information about registered investment companies and money market funds.

title: By Building Wealth, Investors Power U.S. Economy
content: April is Financial Literacy Month, and the SEC is encouraging investors to utilize the agency’s saving and investing resources on Investor.gov.

title: SEC Charges Three Arizona Individuals with Defrauding Investors in $284 Million Municipal Bond Offering That Financed Sports Complex
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today charged Randall “Randy” Miller, Chad Miller, and Jeffrey De Laveaga with creating false documents that were provided to investors in two municipal bond offerings that raised $284 million to build one of the…

content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today voted to end its defense of the rules requiring disclosure of climate-related risks and greenhouse gas emissions.

SEC Acting Chairman Mark T. Uyeda said, “The goal of today’s Commission action and…

title: SEC Crypto Task Force to Host Four More Roundtables
content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will hold four more roundtables in its ongoing series discussing crypto asset regulation.

content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced the agenda and panelists for the March 27 roundtable on artificial intelligence in the financial industry.  

“I look forward to hearing from the panelists on how emerging technologies,…

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that it has filed charges against David Yow Shang Chiueh of East Hanover, New Jersey and his investment advisory firm, Upright Financial Corp., for misconduct and for investing more than 25…

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced a six-month extension of the compliance dates for amendments adopted in September 2023 to the Investment Company Act “Names Rule,” which addresses fund names likely to mislead investors about a fund’…

title: SEC Charges Investment Adviser and Two Officers for Misuse of Fund and Portfolio Company Assets
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today filed settled charges against registered investment adviser Momentum Advisors LLC, its former managing partner Allan J. Boomer, and its former chief operating officer and partner Tiffany L. Hawkins, for…

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission is providing extensive guidance and resources to assist filers with upcoming access and account management enhancements to the security of the agency’s Electronic Data Gathering, Analysis, and Retrieval (EDGAR)…

title: SEC Crypto Task Force to Host Roundtable on Security Status
content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will host a series of roundtables to discuss key areas of interest in the regulation of crypto assets.

title: SEC Staff Facilitates Capital Formation for Companies Planning Public Offerings
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that its Division of Corporation Finance is further facilitating capital formation by enhancing the accommodations available to companies for nonpublic review of draft registration statements.

In…

title: Commissioner Hester Peirce Announces Crypto Task Force Staff
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced the members of the Crypto Task Force staff, which is advising the Commission on matters related to crypto.



The task force is composed of staff from the Acting Chairman’s office and other divisions…

title: SEC to Host Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content: The SEC will hold a roundtable discussion on artificial intelligence and examine the risks, benefits, and governance of it in the financial industry.

title: How Embedded Finance Is Quietly Transforming Startup Business Models
content: Traditional banks are having a hard time keeping up with customers' expectations for embedded finance. In this guest commentary, Arthur Azizov, founder and investor at B2 Ventures, provides some answers to what customers want and why they want it.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Adapting The IPO Roadmap For Today’s Market
content: The path to IPO has become slower and more arduous for companies looking for an exit, writes Fiunder Shield's COO Carl Niedbala. In this guest commentary he lays out some effective measures to help founders be prepared when an opportunity presents itself.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Seed Funding Rose In These Spaces
content: Even as overall seed-stage investment declined in 2024, a few areas saw big gains. This includes the obvious category — AI — as well as a subset of sectors largely focused on automating things that humans currently do. We take a look at four top picks.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.
